column4: can someone tell me what this means "dpkg was interrupted, you must manually run 'dpkg --configure -a' to correct the problem."
that means some piece of software did not finish configuring itself when you updated or installed it
why are you trying to install vmware? vmware is not freedom software.... try qemu or, must faster than vwmware or qemu, xen
find out the package name of vmware (may be just vmware) and try: sudo apt-get remove --purge vmware
if that does not work, try: sudo apt-get -f install
tried the "sudo apt-get -f install" it gave me the same output
what about: sudo dpkg --purge vmware
and why did you try to install vmware!
do you use automatix or some other software like it?
yes I did
how about the add/remove mentioned in the programs tab
try the automatix channel, but don't tell them automatix broke your install (even though it did) because they all have very big egos and will not help you
lol. I think I might have fixed it, I tried uninstalling it through automatix and though it gave me an error it seems it's now gone
not sure which add/remove you are talking about, but you can always try it.... you have to realize that synaptic and add/remove both use apt-get
do yourself a favor and remove automatix before you break something else :)
do you know how I get to the automatix channel?
also, run sudo apt-get -f install and then sudo dpkg --configure -a
not sure what it is, but you can try typing in /j #automatix
#automatix is the channel that i am guessing and /j is short of /join
I finally got it fixed. Apparantly I was able to click ok within the vmware text and click don't accept
now just run what i mentioned above to make sure everything is clean and remove automatix :)
friends don't let friends run automatix
that pages has instructions on java amd64
I have java installed, I just need a plugin for mozilla
